title: As it happened: Bradford 2025 UK City of Culture closing event
description: Brighter Still, the finale of Bradford's UK City of Culture Year, is staged in Bingley's Myrtle Park.
content:
Live coverage ends, but the party continues!
Thanks for joining us for our live coverage of Brighter Still - the finale to Bradford's UK City of Culture year.
Although the live reporting is over, the party continues!

title: The Prem: Saracens 24-30 Exeter: Late Greg Fisilau and Henry Slade tries secure dramatic Chiefs win
description: Exeter score three late tries in a fightback to beat Saracens at StoneX Stadium and go top of the Prem table.
content:
Exeter scored three late tries in a stunning fightback to beat Saracens at StoneX Stadium and go top of the Prem.
Two Greg Fisilau scores pulled in an 11-point deficit before Henry Slade ran in a try in the final action of a pulsating match.

title: Thomas Skinner claims BBC rigged Strictly vote removing him
description: The former contestant alleges he received an "anonymous" email from a BBC executive with stats showing he received "far more" votes.
content:
Former Strictly Come Dancing contestant Thomas Skinner has claimed the BBC rigged the vote that saw him leave the show.
The social media personality alleged in an online post that the night he left the competition he was sent an "anonymous email clai... [2858 chars]

title: World Darts Championship 2026: Chris Dobey beaten but Stephen Bunting wins
description: World number eight Chris Dobey suffers a shock second round exit at the World Darts Championship with a 3-1 loss to Andrew Gilding.
content:
World number eight Chris Dobey suffered a shock second-round exit at the PDC World Championship with a 3-1 loss to Andrew Gilding.
Gilding, 55, came from behind to win at Alexandra Palace, finishing with a career best tournament average of 99.01.

title: World Darts Championship 2026: Chisnall and Van Duivenbode suffer second round exits
description: Seeded players Dave Chisnall and Dirk van Duijvenbode both suffer second round exits at the 2026 World Darts Championship on Saturday.
content:
Former World Darts Championship semi-finalist Dave Chisnall suffered a second round exit at Alexandra Palace with a 3-2 defeat by Germany's Ricardo Pietreczko.
